DataElement.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Version 4 Past One Month Quantity Trouble Getting Along with Others Score 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much of a problem it has been in the past one month with getting along with others, using a 3 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Past 30 Days Quantity Trouble Getting Along with Others Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A parent report or patient self report for measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in healthy children and adolescents and those with acute and chronic health conditions. The PedsQL Measurement Model uses a modular approach that integrates both generic core scales and disease-specific modules into one measurement system. (Copyright 1998-2008 James W. Varni, Ph.D.)_A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number._A question about whether an individual has or had trouble getting along with others._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A parent report or patient self report for measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in healthy children and adolescents and those with acute and chronic health conditions. The PedsQL Measurement Model uses a modular approach that integrates both generic core scales and disease-specific modules into one measurement system. (Copyright 1998-2008 James W. Varni, Ph.D.)

Concepts.definition: A parent report or patient self report for measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in healthy children and adolescents and those with acute and chronic health conditions. The PedsQL Measurement Model uses a modular approach that integrates both generic core scales and disease-specific modules into one measurement system. (Copyright 1998-2008 James W. Varni, Ph.D.)

Property.preferredName: Past 30 Days Quantity Trouble Getting Along with Others Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present.:How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.:A question about whether an individual has or had trouble getting along with others.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.
A question about whether an individual has or had trouble getting along with others.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Score 3 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added "Sometimes" to represent the MSAS value domain.ghd.01.27.15

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a great amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is it hard for you to get lon
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is it hard for you to get long with other kids

ReferenceDocuments.name: PedsQL Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Report (5-7)
Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

DataElement.origin: PedsQL: Pediatric Quality of Life, James W. Varni, Ph.D., 1998
